<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Elucidating Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=1680) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=24" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 120 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Blessed One](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=51) (Level 12)

**Prerequisites**
[Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=225)

</column>

---

Your mercy grants clarity to those around you just when they need it most. When you use [Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=225), you can instead attempt a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check to remove the [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) or [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) conditions, using the source of that condition to determine the counteract level and DC. If the condition was caused by an ongoing effect and you don't remove that effect, the condition returns at the end of your next turn.
name: Elucidating Mercy
